concept.title: What is a reccuring event?
concept.shortdesc: This section provides information about what a recurring event is.

conbody.p: A recurring event is an event that repeats at regular intervals over time, eliminating the need to create separate entries for each occurrence manually. Recurring events are commonly used for activities or commitments that follow a predictable schedule, such as weekly meetings, monthly appointments, or daily reminders. The calendar allows you to set the frequency of repetition, including:

ul.li: Daily: The event repeats every day.
Weekly: The event occurs on the same day(s) each week.
Monthly: The event repeats on a specific date or day of the month.
Yearly: The event occurs annually on the same date.
Custom: Users can define specific intervals (e.g., every 2 weeks or every 3 months).

conbody.p: You can set an end date for the recurring series (e.g., "Repeat until December 31, 2024") or choose to repeat indefinitely.
